item.description:
In the 18th century, at the height of their heyday, pirates' looting to become the sea-dominating Corsair became ncreasingly severe. Only one person who has earned the most fame for his resourcefulness and strategy can become the best pirate king to rule the ocean.

Set Up

 Mix the cards well and divide them according to the number of people.
 2 Players X 8 Cards
 3 Players X 6 Cards
 4 Players X 4 Cards
 



 Leave the remaining cards in the box so that they are not visible and do not use them.
 Place the reputation chips in the center of the table so that everyone can reach them.
 The player who has been to the sea most recently becomes the first player.


Playing the Game

 The first player names a person and takes a card from that person's hand. Take the card without looking at it.
 Place one of the cards in your hand on the center of the table. This place is called the sea. Then, hand the turn over to the next player.
 The next player also nominates one person and takes a card from that person's hand. If only one card remains in the nominee's hand, another person must be named.
 Pirate’s enemy cards summoned to the sea in your turn cannot be placed on the sea. (Enemy card: Check the numbers and characters in the upper right corner of the card)
 If you don't have a card to put down, you'll be eliminated. Flip your cards over and wait for the next round. Repeat until one card remains in the hands of the surviving people.


End of the Game
Each person flip their cards in their hand and picks the best pirate. (Conditions of Victory: Check the back)
The winner earns 1 reputation chip, shuffles all cards, and moves on to the next round. If a player earns 2 reputation chips first, the game ends, and that player wins the final victory. In a two-person play, the first person to get 3 reputation chips wins.
